page.title: 09Education - A camp diary
page.content:
(When undertaking our 'Domesday Survey' of this area we were based at the Old Yarmouth Railway Station. Here is part of an account of that stay written by a 9 year old girl in May 1985.)
On the morning of 15th. May 1985 instead of coming to school in our school uniform we came in trousers and jumpers. Then we waited for the school bus and when it arrived the driver put some tables in the boot together with our luggage. When we arrived at Yarmouth Youth Centre the first thing we did was to open up our beds. I thought unrolling them (they were collapsable camp-beds) would be easy but we had to put the legs on. That was hard so Mrs. Webb (the ancillary helper) had to help us. After that we all walked to .....
